intro: Burttianthus purseglovei, commonly known as the Cape York burttia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is a shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, and its flowers bloom during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
